thread.section_title: The Union Democrat, Sonora, CA News, Sports, & Weather
thread.title: News of Record for Oct. 20, 2015

title: News of Record for Oct. 20, 2015
text: News of Record for Oct. 20, 2015 News of Record for Oct. 20, 2015 By Union Democrat staff October 20, 2015 01:00 am TUOLUMNE COUNTY The Sonora Police Department reported the following: FRIDAY 3:54 p.m., miscellaneous codes — Two men were panhandling on Sanguinetti Road. 4:03 p.m., theft — A woman stole items from a Sanguinetti Road business. 4:16 p.m., theft — A man wearing a black tank top and jeans stole a bike from South Washington Street. SATURDAY 8:16 p.m., theft — A bottle of alcohol was stolen from a Stockton Road business. SUNDAY 4:56 a.m., suspicious circumstances — Unknown people were after a woman on North Norlin Street. 8:06 a.m., suspicious circumstance — Mailboxes on East Jackson Street were opened with mail scattered all along the road. 10:27 a.m., reckless driving — A possibly heavily medicated man sped through an Old Wards Ferry Road parking lot and almost hit vehicles and pedestrians. 1:24 p.m., public intoxication — A heavily intoxicated man refused to leave a Greenley Road business. 8:06 p.m., suspicious circumstances — Someone tried to enter through the back door of a Greenley Road home. The Sheriff’s Office reported the following: FRIDAY 12:17 a.m., Sonora area — Women rummaged through a donation center after hours on Mono Way. 6:53 a.m., Groveland — People inside a turquoise vehicle possibly had a gun and yelled profanities toward a Highway 120 residence. 7:52 a.m., Big Oak Flat — Someone caused a fight and a lit flare inside a Highway 120 business. 8:19 a.m., Tuolumne — Gas was siphoned from two vehicles parked on Evergreen Drive. 9:25 a.m., Tuolumne — An antique dealer continuously returned to a woman’s Tuolumne Road North home and took advantage of her mother by stealing from her and making unfair deals or trades. 11:22 a.m., Groveland — A lock was broken off a Mueller Drive home. 11:59 a.m., Strawberry — A man accused employees of an Old Strawberry Road business of selling drugs. 12 p.m., Sonora area — A Feather River Drive man suspected his neighbor of breaking into his home. 12:06 p.m., Sonora area — A Standard Road student kicked a radio worth $300. 1:56 p.m., Groveland — About 10 people, all with tattoos, possibly “cased” residences and vehicles along Highway 120. 2:35 p.m., Sonora area — A Cuesta Drive person discovered several unauthorized checks that were cashed by an employee of a business. 3:30 p.m., Soulsbyville — A Caylor Drive person’s credit cards were fraudulently used. 4:01 p.m., Groveland — The remote to a Butler Way garage was stolen. 6:24 p.m., Big Oak Flat — A man wearing a cowboy hat walked along Highway 120 waving a knife in the air. 8:07 p.m., Sonora area — Teenage boys were hanging out in a truck parked in a Mono Way parking lot and were “up to no good.” 10:33 p.m., Soulsbyville — A man with short black hair banged on a Caylor Drive woman’s door while screaming and then ran away. 11:06 p.m., Mi-Wuk Village — A Chief Fuller Way man found his friend tied to the back of his deck with a rope after being gone for five hours. He found a bloody note addressed to his roommate along with his roommate’s ex-girlfriend. SATURDAY 9:47 a.m., Twain Harte — A Sierra Drive woman’s neighbor threatened to shoot her dog and opened her back door to yell at her. The neighbor also said he believed her residence should be bulldozed and that her “house will go up quick if there is a fire.” 9:48 a.m., Jamestown — Two goats were found loose on Peppermint Creek Road. 11:17 a.m., Big Oak Flat — A man was beat up on Scofield Road. 8:31 p.m., Jamestown — The driver of a lifted pickup truck with blue and purple flames attempted to steal gas on Victoria Place. 9:52 p.m., Tuolumne — Four minors were drinking beer in the parking garage of a Tuolumne Road North business. SUNDAY 10:15 a.m., Tuolumne — A threatening note was found on a boat parked on Mira Monte Road. 10:35 a.m., Jamestown — A North Drive woman’s social media account. The hacker is sending harassing messages to people with her account. 12:56 p.m., Sonora area — A Feather River Drive woman’s clothing was thrown around her home. 3:54 p.m., Sonora area — A pistol was found in a creek behind a man’s Hidden Valley Road home. 5:02 p.m., Soulsbyville — Someone stole $925 out of a Monte Grande Drive woman’s planner. 6:02 p.m., Sonora area — An Eagle Ridge Drive woman’s cell phone was stolen. 7:03 p.m., Sonora area — Two boxes of checks were stolen on Sallander Drive. 7:58 p.m., Sonora area — A man tried to gain entry to a Salmon River Court residence through a back window. Felony bookings FRIDAY 4 a.m., Sonora — Bobby Earnst Cash, 33, transient, was booked on suspicion of four charges of unlawful use of personal identifying information, conspiracy to commit a crime and burglary after an arrest at the Tuolumne County Jail. 6:49 p.m., Sonora — Keith Louis Dolinshek, 49, of the 22000 block of Feather River Drive, was booked on suspicion of attempted kidnapping after an arrest on Feather River Drive. SATURDAY 11:20 a.m., Jamestown area — Vanessa Marie Garcia, 24, of the 1000 block of Elm Avenue, Atwater, was booked on suspicion of bringing alcohol or drugs into prison or jail, bringing or sending a firearm, deadly weapon or explosive into a penal institution and misdemeanors possession of marijuana or hashish and possession of open container while driving after an arrest at Sierra Conservation Center. 11:20 a.m., Jamestown area — Arlette Carina Guillen, 27, of the 2000 block of Olive Avenue, Atwater, was booked on suspicion of bringing a weapon or tear gas into prison or jail, bringing alcohol or drugs into prison or jail and misdemeanor possession of marijuana or hashish and possession of an open container while driving after an arrest at Sierra Conservation Center. SUNDAY 1:39 a.m., Jamestown — Bryce Jordan David Lawrence, 26, transient, was booked on suspicion of conspiracy to commit a crime and misdemeanor attempted petty theft after an arrest on Seco Street. 1:39 a.m., Jamestown — Ryan Allen Robles, 30, of Telele Street, Mi-Wuk Village, was booked on suspicion of conspiracy to commit a crime and misdemeanor attempted petty theft, possession of burglary tools, driving with a suspended license and unlawful display of evidence of registration after an arrest on Seco Street. 1:39 a.m., Jamestown — Regine Carlos Buenaseda, 23, of the 300 block of San Antonio Court, San Jose, was booked on suspicion of conspiracy to commit a crime and misdemeanor attempted petty theft after an arrest on Seco Street. Arrests Cited on suspicion of driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs: SUNDAY Jamestown — Roxann Marie Ivaldi, 55, of the 500 block of Shawn Vines Avenue, Oakdale, was booked after an arrest on Highway 49. CALAVERAS COUNTY The Sheriff’s Office reported the following: FRIDAY 3:02 p.m., Copperopolis — A woman and a man traveling with a backpack screamed at a person after being asked if they were OK on Bow Drive. 6:46 p.m., San Andreas — People set off fireworks in the area of West Murray Creek Road. SATURDAY 11 a.m., Valley Springs — Halloween decorations were destroyed on Little Dipper Court. 12:55 p.m., San Andreas — Medications were stolen on Highway 49. 3:25 p.m., Mountain Ranch — Dogs were stolen from a Buttondown Lane residence. SUNDAY 11:18 p.m., San Andreas — A person with a flashlight was seen outside a High Country Road residence. Felony bookings FRIDAY 11:43 p.m., Angels Camp — Alma Catalina Wasco, 35, of the 600 block of Copello Drive, was booked on suspicion of willful cruelty to a child and misdemeanor possession of controlled substances after an arrest at her home. SATURDAY 6 p.m., Angels Camp — Denise Elaine Aanonson, 51, address unavailable, was booked on suspicion of being a felon or addict in possession of a firearm after an arrest on South Main Street. Arrests Cited on suspicion of driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs: FRIDAY 5:15 p.m., Avery — Ronald Lee Rowland, 63, of the 100 block of Horsehoe Drive, Hathaway Pines, was booked after an arrest on Avery Sheep Ranch Road. SATURDAY 6:08 a.m., Valley Springs — Dino Albert Caraveo Jr., 27, of the 2000 block of Louise Avenue, Tracy, was booked after an arrest on Highway 26. SUNDAY 4:25 p.m., San Andreas — Breanna Eastridge, 20, of the 4000 block of Irene Drive, Martinez, was booked on suspicion of human trafficking and misdemeanor prostitution after an arrest at the Calaveras County Sheriff’s Office. Follow UnionDemocrat.com
